oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Atlas of the city of Nashville 1908. [Plate 06A]
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 1 map; 58 x 75 cm. A plat map of downtown Nashville, Tennessee, originally published in 1908 by G. M. Hopkins Company, showing the various buildings, landscapes, acreage, and street routes for several blocks. Original building structures and landmarks are depicted on the map, including United Church of Primitive Baptist, Broadway Stables, St. Joseph's Catholic Church and School, Jackson Chapel, Howard Chapel and Fisk University. This plat map is reproduced from the source: Atlas of the city of Nashville, Tennessee : from official records, private plans and actual surveys, G. M. Hopkins, [Philadelphia, Pa.]1908. Scale 100 feet to an inch. The original dimensions of the map, in the atlas publication: 15 1/2 x 22 3/4 in. (i.e. 58 x 75 cm.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United Church of Primitive Baptist (Nashville, Tenn.); St. Joseph's Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Fisk University; Howard Chapel (Nashville, Tenn.); Jackson Chapel (Nashville, Tenn.)
